Tantangan  teknologi  dan persiapan manusia dalam upaya kolonisasi MarsIlmuwan meyakini bahwa umat manusia memiliki kemungkinan untuk bisa menemukan tempat tinggal baru diluar daripada bumi  oleh karena itu pencarian akan planet ya...Tantangan  teknologi  dan persiapan manusia dalam upaya kolonisasi Mars | by Andinj | Aug  2025 | MediumSitemapOpen in appSign upSign inMedium LogoWriteSign upSign inAndinj9 min read·Just now--ShareTantangan  teknologi  dan persiapan manusia dalam upaya kolonisasi MarsIlmuwan meyakini bahwa umat manusia memiliki kemungkinan untuk bisa menemukan tempat tinggal baru diluar daripada bumi  oleh karena itu pencarian akan planet yang sekiranya cocok untuk ditinggali masih terus dilakukan  salah satu planet yang diyakini dapat ditinggali adalah Mars. Mars yang memiliki julukan sebagai “planet merah” akibat dari besi oksida yang berbentuk debu sehingga mudah terbawa oleh badai besar di planet tersebut.Dikutip dari situs resmi NASA  bahwa Mars dulunya memiliki sumber air yang bahkan lebih banyak dari samudra Arktik  sehingga sangat memungkinkan bagi hewan maupun tumbuhan untuk hidup. Menurut NASA  Mungkin sekitar 4 3 miliar tahun yang lalu  Mars memiliki cukup air untuk menutupi seluruh permukaannya dalam lapisan cair sedalam sekitar 137 meter. Kemungkinan besar  air tersebut membentuk samudra yang menempati hampir separuh belahan utara Mars  di beberapa wilayah mencapai kedalaman lebih dari 1 6 kilometer. bila mana kita menemukan air di tempat manapun  maka pasti ada kehidupan di tempat tersebut: “Bila Mars pernah memiliki air yang cair  atau masih memilikinya hari ini  menarik untuk bertanya apakah kehidupan mikroskopik dalam bentuk apa pun telah berkembang dipermukaannya?”Press enter or click to view image in full sizePara ilmuwan NASA telah memastikan bahwa samudra purba di Mars menyimpan lebih banyak air daripada Samudra Arktik Bumi  dan Planet Merah tersebut telah kehilangan 87 persen air tersebut ke luar angkasa. Kredit: NASA/GSFCPenelitian di permukaan Mars di mulai pada 1970an  yang mengirimkan dua robot Viking 1 dan 2  untuk mencari kehidupan mikroba  penelitian tersebut membawakan hasil yang positif  yaitu bukti bahwa planet tersebut pernah aktif secara geologis  dengan bukti – adanya bekas aliran sungai  yang diduga kuat adalah air dalam jumlah banyak – di masa lalu. Beberapa mineral yang ditemukan: Lempung Kaya Besi: Penjelajah Viking 1 dan 2 menemukan mineral lempung kaya besi di tanah Mars  yang hanya bisa terbentuk jika ada air cair. Namun  Eksperimen biologi wahana pendarat Viking tidak menghasilkan bukti yang pasti tentang adanya kehidupan di permukaannya.Press enter or click to view image in full sizeGambar wahana antariksa Viking  dengan pendaratnya terbungkus bioshield. Kredit: NASAPress enter or click to view image in full sizeAstronom Universitas Cornell  Carl Sagan  berdiri di samping model wahana pendarat Viking untuk memberikan skala. Kredit: NASAberbagai tantangan muncul dalam misi manusia untuk menjadikan Mars sebagai koloni selain bumi  salah satunya adalah keadaan atmosfer Mars yang tidak memungkinkan bagi manusia untuk tinggal di dalamnya.Dikutip dari Info Astronomy  bahwa “tekanan atmosfer di Mars tidak cukup untuk mempertahankan air dalam bentuk cair  kurangnya magnetosfer dan tipisnya atmosfer menjadi tantangan. Di permukaan planet ini tidak banyak terjadi perpindahan panas  penyekatan terhadap angin Surya terbilang rendah  sehingga dapat menyebabkan atmosfer Mars menjadi lebih tipis”Atmosfer Mars sangat tipis  hanya 1% yang merupakan atmosfer milik bumi  1 9% nitrogen  1 9% argon  sisanya adalah karbondioksida  dan sedikit jejak dari oksigen dan karbon monoksida. Penelitian di Mars mengungkapkan bahwa planet tersebut telah kehilangan atmosfernya  sebanyak 65% Argon yang pernah ada di atmosfernya telah hilang keluar angkasa. "Kami telah menentukan bahwa sebagian besar gas yang pernah ada di atmosfer Mars telah hilang ke luar angkasa " kata Bruce Jakosky  peneliti utama Mars Atmosphere and Volatile Evolution Mission (MAVEN)  Universitas Colorado di Boulder.Press enter or click to view image in full sizeInfografis ini menunjukkan bagaimana Mars kehilangan argon dan gas lainnya seiring waktu akibat 'sputtering’. Kredit: NASATantangan besar lainnya bagi misi untuk menjadikan Mars sebagai “Bumi kedua” adalah kondisi alam  Mars adalah gurun dingin  dengan struktur tanah yang keras dan berkerak. Mars terkenal dengan badai debu yang hebat  yang terkadang menimbulkan cukup banyak debu hingga dapat dilihat oleh teleskop dari bumi. Berdasarkan perkataan Michael Smith  seorang ilmuwan planet di Pusat Penerbangan Luar Angkasa Goddard NASA di Greenbelt  Maryland: “Setiap tahun ada beberapa badai debu yang cukup besar yang muncul di Mars dan menutupi area seukuran benua dan berlangsung selama berminggu-minggu "Jika badainya bisa berlangsung selama berminggu-minggu  maka akan sangat sulit bagi manusia untuk membangun koloni di sana  tidak mungkin bagi manusia untuk dapat beraktivitas di tengah badai debu. Planet Mars juga hampir mati secara geologis; aktivitas vulkanik telah sepenuhnya berakhir  menyebabkan terhentinya pendaur ulangan bahan kimia dan mineral antara permukaan dengan bagian dalam planet.Jika sebuah koloni dibentuk  maka perlu usaha berkesinambungan dan berbiaya besar untuk memeliharanya  termasuk misi penyelamatan. Lebih jauh lagi  isolasi jangka panjang bagi penduduk Mars mungkin memakan korban. pada 2013 proyek Mars One mengumumkan ingin merekrut empat orang untuk dikirim dalam misi kolonisasi Mars  Chris Chamber  seorang profesor ilmu saraf kognitif di Universitas Cardiff  memperingatkan tentang risiko psikologis yang akan dihadapi oleh penduduk di Mars jika seandainya proses kolonisasi berjalan dan dalam skala yang besar.Penelitian pada tahun 2017  mengungkapkan bahwa permukaan Mars mungkin lebih berbahaya bagi mikroorganisme dari pada yang diduga.Dikutip dari Scientific Report  astronom Jennifer Wadsworth dan Charles S. Cockell  telah menemukan perklorat  sebuah zat yang membuat bakteri tidak dapat bertahan hidup  zat ini ditemukan melimpah di permukaan Mars.Namun  meskipun berbagai tantangan dihadapi  para peneliti tetap berupaya untuk membangun koloni di Mars. Berdasarkan pernyataan NASA: “Bahkan meskipun Mars tidak memiliki kehidupan masa lalu atau masa kini  bagaimanapun juga  masih banyak hal menarik di cakrawala. Kita sendiri mungkin menjadi “kehidupan di Mars  jika manusia memilih pergi kesana suatu hari nanti”Dalam upaya menyiapkan proses tersebut  NASA dan beberapa lembaga yang terlibat  menggelontorkan bermiliar-miliar dolar AS  untuk mengembangkan teknologi-teknologi terbaru yang nantinya berguna bagi misi kolonisasi di Mars  dimulai dengan pengembangan terhadap baju Astronot yang dapat melindungi mereka dari debu partikel yang merusak  hingga pengembangan fisi nuklir demi energi berkelanjutan di Mars.Melalui misi perseverance  pada tahun 2021 robot penjelajah milik NASA mendarat di Mars  sambil membawa empat sampel bahan pakaian antariksa  dan para ilmuwan melakukan penilaian bagaimana keempat pakaian tersebut dapat bertahan setelah empat tahun di planet Mars. Apa yang dipelajari badan antariksa tentang kinerja material dari keempat sampel pakaian tersebut  di Mars akan menjadi dasar perancangan pakaian antariksa masa depan bagi para astronot di Planet Merah.Dikutip dari situs resmi NASA:” Sampel tersebut  masing-masing berukuran tiga perempat inci persegi (20 milimeter persegi)  merupakan bagian dari target kalibrasi yang digunakan untuk menguji pengaturan SHERLOC (Pemindaian Lingkungan Layak Huni dengan Raman & Luminescence untuk Bahan Organik dan Bahan Kimia)  instrumen di ujung lengan Perseverance.”Sampel-sampel tersebut meliputi sepotong pelindung helm polikarbonat; Vectran  bahan tahan potong yang digunakan untuk telapak tangan sarung tangan astronot; dua jenis Teflon  yang memiliki sifat anti-lengket anti-debu; dan bahan pakaian antariksa yang umum digunakan bernama Ortho-Fabric. Kain terakhir ini memiliki beberapa lapisan  termasuk Nomex  bahan tahan api yang ditemukan pada pakaian pemadam kebakaran; Gore-Tex  yang kedap air namun tetap bernapas; dan Kevlar  bahan kuat yang digunakan dalam rompi antipeluru yang membuat pakaian antariksa lebih tahan sobekPress enter or click to view image in full sizeGrafik ini menunjukkan ilustrasi prototipe pakaian antariksa (kiri)  beserta sampel pakaian yang dibawa oleh wahana penjelajah Perseverance milik NASA. Ini adalah material pakaian antariksa pertama yang pernah dikirim ke Mars. Kredit: NASAPress enter or click to view image in full sizePakaian antariksa generasi baru NASA dirancang untuk memberi astronaut lebih banyak mobilitas di Bulan dan Mars. Kredit: NASA“Ini adalah salah satu aspek berwawasan ke depan dari misi penjelajah ini — tidak hanya memikirkan sains terkini  tetapi juga tentang apa yang akan terjadi selanjutnya " kata ilmuwan planet Marc Fries dari Johnson Space Center NASA di Houston  yang membantu menyediakan bahan-bahan pakaian antariksa. "Kami sedang mempersiapkan manusia untuk akhirnya pergi dan menjelajahi Mars.”Seolah selangkah lagi menuju terwujudnya peradaban di Mars  NASA berhasil membuat sebuah teknologi Produksi oksigen lokal (MOXIE)  yang bisa memproduksi oksigen dari atmosfer kaya akan karbondioksida di planet Mars.MOXIE sebuah benda kotak kecil yang dapat melakukan pekerjaan pohon untuk memproduksi oksigen. MOXIE bekerja dengan mengambil atmosfer Mars yang penuh dengan karbon dioksida melalui filter HEPA penangkap debu  kemudian mengompres atmosfer melalui pompa gulir  memanaskannya hingga 800°Celcius  dan mengirimkannya melalui rakitan elektrolisis oksida padat (SOXE)  tempat Karbon dioksida mengalir di atas katoda yang dikatalisis berbasis nikel dan terurai menjadi ion oksigen dan karbon monoksida. Elektrolit keramik zirkonia yang distabilkan scandia secara selektif melewatkan ion oksigen ke anoda  tempat ion-ion tersebut bergabung kembali menjadi oksigen diatomik  yang diukur jumlah dan kemurniannya sebelum dilepaskan ke atmosfer Mars. Buangan katoda adalah campuran karbon dioksida   karbon monoksida  dan gas atmosfer inert  terutama argon dan nitrogen.Press enter or click to view image in full sizeMOXIE dengan penutup depan dilepas  memperlihatkan kompresor dan rakitan SOXE. Filter saluran masuk  sensor dan panel kontrol aliran  serta komponen elektronik tidak ditampilkan. Dimensi sasis MOXIE adalah 23 9 cm x 23 9 cm x 30 9 cm. Kredit: Science AdvanceMOXIE menjadi temuan yang menjanjikan bagi para ilmuwan  dalam rencananya  MOXIE harus dikirim terlebih dahulu ke Mars sebelum misi Manusia."Ini adalah demonstrasi pertama yang benar-benar menggunakan sumber daya di permukaan benda planet lain  dan mengubahnya secara kimiawi menjadi sesuatu yang akan berguna untuk misi manusia " kata wakil penyelidik utama MOXIE Jeffrey Hoffman  seorang profesor praktik di Departemen MIT bidang Aeronautika dan Astronautika.Teknologi Laser  kecepatan komunikasi dari Mars ke Bumi.Teknologi radio yang digunakan saat ini membutuhkan waktu yang sangat lama untuk mengirim peta Mars ke Bumi  setidaknya membutuhkan waktu selama sembilan tahun  tetapi dengan teknologi laser yang baru dikembangkan oleh NASA  alih-alih sembilan tahun  waktu tersebut bisa dipersingkat menjadi 9 Minggu saja. Misi manusia ke Mars lebih baik menggunakan teknologi Laser untuk tetap terhubung dengan Bumi. Teknologi Laser ini  bisa mengirimkan sejumlah besar Informasi dan data secara real-time termasuk gambar dan video.Dari Situs resmi NASA: “NASA membuktikan komunikasi laser mungkin dengan demonstrasi dari Bulan pada tahun 2013. Demo berikutnya dari badan tersebut akan bekerja melalui berbagai skenario operasional  menyempurnakan sistem penunjuk  dan mengatasi tantangan teknologi dari orbit Bumi rendah – hal-hal seperti awan dan gangguan komunikasi lainnya. NASA sedang membangun sistem kecil untuk menguji penerbangan luar angkasa manusia  termasuk di Stasiun Luar Angkasa Internasional dan misi Artemis berawak pertama. Muatan komunikasi laser lainnya akan menjelajah ke luar angkasa untuk membantu menginformasikan apa yang diperlukan untuk menggunakan teknologi yang sama jutaan dan jutaan mil jauhnya dari Bumi”Berbeda dengan Bumi  Mars tidak memiliki sumber daya yang melimpah  sehingga dibutuhkan teknologi yang bisa memasok listrik ke Mars tanpa batas.Badai debu di Mars dapat mengurangi jumlah cahaya matahari yang masuk  selain itu  partikel-partikel debu di Mars sangat kecil dan bersifat elektrostatik.Dikutip dari situs resmi NASA  “Debu merupakan masalah yang sangat besar bagi panel surya. Bahkan pusaran debu berukuran hanya beberapa kaki—yang jauh lebih kecil daripada badai debu biasa—dapat membawa debu yang cukup banyak untuk menutupi peralatan dan mengurangi jumlah sinar matahari yang mengenai panel. Berkurangnya sinar matahari berarti berkurangnya energi yang dihasilkan”Ini berarti bahwa panel Surya sangat rentan terhadap ancaman debu  sehingga sangat tidak cocok jika digunakan di Mars  untuk mengatasi tantangan ini  NASA mengembangkan teknologi fisi nuklir demi pasokan listrik yang aman dan berkelanjutan di Mars.Dikutip dari situs resmi NASA  “NASA telah menguji teknologi fisi nuklir Bumi dan menunjukkan bahwa teknologi ini aman  efisien  dan cukup berlimpah untuk memungkinkan misi permukaan jangka panjang. NASA berencana untuk mendemonstrasikan dan menggunakan sistem tenaga fisi di Bulan terlebih dahulu  kemudian di Mars.”Press enter or click to view image in full sizeIlustrasi konsep sistem tenaga fisi nuklir di Mars. Kredit: NASA“Eksplorasi dan observasi ruang angkasa adalah sebuah langkah tepat untuk mengetahui misteri di balik alam semesta. Dengan melihat progres penelitian yang dilakukan manusia  membuat kita optimis akan adanya tempat tinggal baru  di planet baru. AI That Thinks With You: Designing Cognitive Tools for Human ComplexityMost AI tools today are built for clarity  speed  and output. But human thinking doesn’t always move like that. We loop. We pause. We zoom in and out. We shif...AI That Thinks With You: Designing Cognitive Tools for Human Complexity | by Sára | Soft EDGE Studio | Aug  2025 | MediumSitemapOpen in appSign upSign inMedium LogoWriteSign upSign inAI That Thinks With You: Designing Cognitive Tools for Human ComplexitySára | Soft EDGE Studio3 min read·Just now--ListenShareSára OlsenWhat if AI didn’t just respond to what you typed – but adapted to how you think?Most AI tools today are built for clarity  speed  and output. But human thinking doesn’t always move like that. We loop. We pause. We zoom in and out. We shift tone depending on mood  energy  or cognitive load.Despite advances in human-AI collaboration  current systems still prioritize task efficiency over cognitive resonance – neglecting how humans actually navigate complex thought (Amershi et al.  2019; Shneiderman  2020).This reflection stems from lived experimentation – not academic research  but hands-on orchestration of AI threads across real-world creative  strategic  and emotional work.Beyond Input-Output: Orchestration as Interaction DesignWhen I started working with multiple AI threads – one for structure  one for tone  one for insight – something changed. Instead of trying to “get better prompts ” I began conducting the system like a layered conversation.That shift led me to develop:Flow Anchors™ – simple prompts like “Pause for synthesis” or “Switch rhythm” to regulate attention and momentum (see also Zimmerman  2002).Meaning Modulation™ – adjusting the tone  style  or depth of AI responses based on my emotional or cognitive bandwidth (see Picard  1997; Tkalčič & Chen  2015).These aren’t productivity hacks. They’re scaffolds for metacognition and emotional self-regulation – still mostly missing from AI design.What’s Missing in Current Research and DesignWhile agentic AI  adaptive learning systems  and AI tutors are rapidly evolving  there’s still limited focus on:Emotionally responsive UX in AI workflowsTools that support cognitive rhythm and reflectionMetacognitive scaffolding in everyday AI interaction (Winne & Hadwin  1998; Sengers et al.  2005)In educational and design contexts  we’re still building AI to inform – not to resonate.A Personal Framework: The Valley of CollaborationOver time  I started visualizing the process as a terrain – what I now call the Valley of Collaboration. In this model  AI agents play different cognitive roles. The human moves between them – not linearly  but rhythmically. Not just as “user ” but as navigator.This valley isn’t a product. It’s a way to think about thinking – and design for it.Closing ThoughtThis isn’t a research paper. It’s a field note. But it points to something worth exploring:What would AI look like if it helped us think in rhythm with ourselves?Not just smarter – but softer. Not just fast – but aware.Let’s build tools that adapt as we do.Methodology & ContextThis article presents a reflective synthesis grounded in practitioner-based inquiry rather than empirical experimentation. The concepts discussed – such as Flow Anchors™  Meaning Modulation™  and the Valley of Collaboration – emerged through sustained interaction with AI systems (primarily large language models) in the context of creative ideation  strategy development  and learning design.Over the course of several months  I engaged in structured multi-threaded dialogues with AI agents  each assigned a distinct cognitive role (e.g.  strategist  editor  emotional mirror). These sessions were iteratively documented  clustered  and synthesized using digital scaffolding tools such as Notion. Recurring patterns in emotional rhythm  cognitive pacing  and task navigation informed the conceptual models presented here.This work draws from a multidisciplinary foundation – including cognitive science  affective computing  metacognitive theory  and reflective UX design – to explore how AI systems might support more emotionally attuned and cognitively adaptive human workflows.Although exploratory and situated in practice  the intention is to contribute to an ongoing conversation within human-computer interaction (HCI)  educational technology  and AI-assisted cognition. This article should be read as an applied perspective that bridges lived experience with theoretical insight – intended to invite further dialogue and refinement across disciplines.✍️ About the AuthorSára Olsen works across psychology  language  and creative systems design. Her work focuses on emotionally intelligent workflows and cognitive scaffolding for interdisciplinary thinkers.🔍 Selected ReferencesAmershi  S.  Weld  D.  Vorvoreanu  M.  Fourney  A.  Nushi  B.  Collisson  P.  … & Horvitz  E. (2019). Guidelines for human-AI interaction. CHI ’19.Picard  R. W. (1997). Affective Computing. MIT Press.Sengers  P.  Boehner  K.  David  S.  & Kaye  J. (2005). Reflective design. Critical Computing  49 – 58.Shneiderman  B. (2020). Human-centered artificial intelligence: Reliable  safe & trustworthy. IJHCI  36(6)  495 – 504.Tkalčič  M.  & Chen  L. (2015). Emotions and personality in personalized services. Springer.Winne  P. H.  & Hadwin  A. F. (1998). Studying as self-regulated learning. Metacognition in Educational Theory and Practice  93  27 – 30.Zimmerman  B. J. (2002). Becoming a self-regulated learner: An overview. Theory into Practice  41(2)  64 – 70.AIHumancomputer InteractionUser ExperienceLearningTechnology----Written by Sára | Soft EDGE Studio1 follower·50 followingAI + Creativity | Strategic Foresight | UX & Cognitive Systems [LinkedIn: Sára Olsen] (https://www.linkedin.com/in/sára-olsen/)No responses yetHelpStatusAboutCareersPressBlogPrivacyRulesTermsText to speech

that scaling without relying solely on algorithm luck.Body Language Tip for Ad Videos:Speak directly to one person  not the crowd.Keep movements controlled and expressions confident because people You gain new customers without ad spend.◀️ Stop scrolling down Get It Now!Body Language Tip for Affiliate Recruitment Videos:Use inviting gestures (arms opening out) to symbolize partnership.Smile warmly and nod as you talk  it creates a “team player” vibe.Step 19: Build Your Community for Repeat BuyersBusiness Growth isn’t just about getting new customers it’s about turning customers into Calls:Keep a relaxed posture (lean back slightly) to create a friendly environment.Use micro-smiles when listeningit shows you value input.Avoid crossing arms  which can feel closed-off.Step 20: The (Darryl Dyck/CP)                                  By The Canadian Press       Posted August 14  2025 9:05 am.     The Vancouver Whitecaps are set to unveil their newest acquisition with the introduction of German soccer star Thomas Muller. The Major League Soccer club signed the 35-year-old attacking midfielder last week  bringing him to Vancouver for the rest of the 2025 season. The deal also includes a Designated Player option for the 2026 campaign.  Related:   Vancouver Whitecaps FC signs German soccer star   Muller landed at Vancouver International Airport Wednesday and was greeted by Indigenous leaders and a large crowd of cheering fans  many of whom he signed autographs for and took photos with.   Vancouver  you made Müller feel right at home. ????#VWFC x #TM13 pic.twitter.com/TJYOt2xKa7— Vancouver Whitecaps FC (@WhitecapsFC) August 14  2025   He joins the Whitecaps following 17 years with Bayern Munich  where he scored 250 goals for the German Bundesliga side across all competitions  helping the team to 13 league championships and 33 total titles. Muller won the 2014 World Cup with Germany  scoring five goals in the tournament  and took home the Golden Boot from the 2010 World Cup in South Africa  finishing with five goals and three assists. This report by The Canadian Press was first published Aug. 14  2025. (ANTARA FOTO/Mohammad Ayudha/rwa)            Jakarta (ANTARA) - Indonesia's Ministry of Villages and Development of Disadvantaged Regions is preparing facilitators to assist managers of village cooperatives in operating their business units.
 
 "We will enhance the facilitators' capacity and knowledge regarding cooperatives and business operations " said Nugroho Setijo Nagoro  the ministry's Director General of Village and Rural Development  on Thursday.
 
 He made the statement during the Dissemination of Information on the Regulation of the Minister of Villages and Development of Disadvantaged Regions Number 10 of 2025 concerning the mechanism for obtaining village heads’ approval for the financing of Red and White Village Cooperatives.
 
 According to Nagoro  the village facilitators will provide daily assistance to the cooperatives to ensure smooth operations of their business units. The effort also aims to promote professional management of village cooperatives.
 
 On the occasion  he also urged cooperative managers to take advantage of training programs provided by the Ministry of Cooperatives  which he said are essential for ensuring effective operations.
 
 Earlier  the ministry issued the regulation outlining various provisions related to the financing of the Red and White Village Cooperatives program.
 
 One stipulation allows village funds to be used to help repay loans if a village cooperative is unable to meet its installments.
 
 President Prabowo Subianto officially launched around 80 000 village cooperatives under the program in Klaten  Central Java  on July 21.
 
 The cooperatives are envisioned as hubs for economic and social services in village communities  offering savings  loans  and health clinic services  among others. Related news: Indonesia plans 60 cooperatives to run gold mines in West Lombok

By Adele Wilson August 14  2025 Share this  This Dragon Raja Rerise Reroll guide contains step-by-step instructions to help you perform a reroll in the gacha! For more free rewards in your Dragon Raja Rise mailbox  take a look at our Dragon Raja Rise Codes guide.Dragon Raja Rerise Reroll GuideDo you need to reroll in Dragon Raja Rerise? Well  it’s entirely up to you. Many players choose to reroll because they didn’t get the character they wanted. This can either be because they like a certain character or they want the ‘meta’ for the start of their journey.How to Reroll in Dragon Raja ReriseBecause Dragon Raja Rerise doesn’t let you skip the tutorial stages  the reroll process can be quite long  as you need to replay the same content over and over again.Open Dragon Raja Rerise on your devicePlay until you unlock the in-game mailboxOnce you have access to the in-game mailbox  you can claim your free rewards (including currency for the gacha banner)After unlocking the gacha system and the banners  you can use your in-game currency to pull for new charactersIf you are not happy with the character (or characters) that you get  it’s time to start the reroll processOpen the in-game settings by selecting the cogwheel icon to the right on your profile page (to get to your profile page  select your avatar icon in the bottom left of the main screen)Within the settings  find your account data  and delete itThis means you’ll have to log in again  preferably with a guest account  so as not to complicate the processAfter logging in with a guest account  unfortunately  you have to complete the tutorial stages all over again until you gain access to the in-game mailbox and gacha bannerWhen you’ve claimed your free rewards from your mailbox again  and you can access the gacha banner  you can roll!If you didn’t get the character (or characters) you want  you can repeat the above steps againOnce you get the character (or characters) you want  you can bind your account with an email or social media account to save your progressDownloadsRelated stories    WalkthroughsAugust 14  2025 Dragon Raja Rerise Tier List – Best CBT CharactersBy Adele Wilson Which Dragon Raja Rerise characters are the best? Innovators & Disruptors                                                   Economy 4.0                                                                                  U.S.                     Trump-Putin Summit                     Epstein Video                     World                     Politics                     HealthWatch                     MoneyWatch                     Entertainment                     Crime                     Sports                           Watch CBS News                    Politics  In governor's race  Spanberger makes economic pitch to Virginia's Latino voters in radio ad         By                                        Anne  Bryson   August 14  2025 / 12:05 PM EDT           / CBS News                                                                                 Full Interview: Abigail Spanberger                             Full Interview: Abigail Spanberger on her run for Virginia governor 13:45     Democrat Abigail Spanberger is working to make inroads with Latino voters ahead of the 2025 Virginia gubernatorial election  releasing her first Spanish-language radio ad on Thursday.The former congresswoman addresses rising costs  telling voters in Spanish  "I know what it's like for families today. I got things done to lower costs. That's what I'll do as governor  too." Democrats across the country are working to regain the Latino support the party lost in the 2024 elections. President Trump made inroads with Latino voters both nationally and in key battleground states in the last election  outpacing Vice President Kamala Harris among Latino men. CBS News exit polling found the economy was the top issue for these voters  and most said they were worse off financially than they were four years earlier. But polling since Mr. Trump's inauguration suggests that support among Latinos is now slipping. Unidos US polling of Latino voters on the first 100 days of Mr. Trump's second term suggests that only 19% felt the economy is better  compared to 2024. Looking ahead to 2026  29% of Latino voters believe the economic policies being implemented will make their own personal finances better. The economy ranks as their No. 1 priority. Sixty percent said Mr. Trump and congressional Republicans are not focusing enough on bringing down the cost of everyday goods. A spokesperson for Spanberger's campaign said she's "meeting Latino Virginians where they are — on the ground and in-language — and will continue connecting with and listening to Virginians in every community to emphasize her focus on lowering costs for families  keeping communities safe  and preparing the next generation of Virginians for success."   Latinos make up almost 11% of Virginia's total population  according to the Census Bureau  and their numbers are expected to continue to rise. Democratic strategist Chuck Rocha thinks Spanberger's focus on Latino voters is strategically smart. "We saw in the last few cycles the Latino vote nationally has moved 18 points more Republican " Rocha said. "She's starting early to build a narrative about what she's going to do to make people's lives better  and this affordability issue is the best place to be with Latinos right now." Spanberger has promised to work to lower the costs of health care and prescription drugs  housing and energy  as governor.Her ad also takes aim at her opponent  GOP Lt. Gov. Winsome Earle-Sears  for supporting Trump administration policy proposals like shutting down the Department of Education.    "Sears backs Trump's cuts to education and health care  too " the ad says. "We need a governor who fights for Virginia  not Trump." Earle-Sears is campaigning on her work alongside Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin and promising to continue his agenda if she's elected. On Thursday  her campaign announced a six-figure ad buy that highlights her record and labels Spanberger  who represented Virginia in Congress for six years  as a "Washington insider." She criticizes Spanberger in a TV ad  saying that the former congresswoman "voted with Pelosi and Biden every single time." "That kind of Beltway nonsense will only take us backwards " Earle-Sears says in the ad. "Governor Youngkin put us on the right path. Now I'm asking for your vote to keep it that way."Virginia's race for governor is often viewed as a referendum on the administration  since it occurs a year after the presidential election. In an interview with CBS News in June  Spanberger said Virginians like the fact that they're one of two states that will elect a new governor in 2025: "This November  Virginia gets to be the first to the polls  along with our friends up in New Jersey  to be able to make clear what it is that we want in our state leadership."               © 2025 CBS Interactive Inc. Target  Ulta to end partnershipThe Ulta Beauty at Target shop-in-shop concept will cease next year as both companies shift focus to retail fundamentals. Published Aug. 14  2025              Dani James Reporter         post      share      post      print      email      license                                An Ulta Beauty at Target shop in Washington  D.C.                           Kaarin Vembar/Retail Dive                            Listen to the article         3 min                   This audio is auto-generated. Please let us know if you have feedback.            Dive Brief:  About five years after it started  the Ulta Beauty at Target shop-in-shop partnership will end  according to a joint press release Thursday.  Both companies have mutually decided to conclude the partnership at the end of the current agreement in August 2026. Customers with linked Ulta Beauty Rewards and Target Circle accounts will continue to earn Ulta rewards points on eligible purchases until then. Target and Ulta “remain committed to delivering a seamless shopping experience and product availability through the end of the partnership  as well as continuing to support their teams and partners during the transition ” per the release.                      Dive Insight: The partnership's conclusion marks the end of a notable retail experiment between two major companies. “We’re proud of our shared success with Ulta Beauty and the experience we’ve delivered together ” Target’s Chief Commercial Officer Rick Gomez said in a statement. “We look forward to what’s ahead and remain committed to offering the beauty experience consumers have come to expect from Target — one centered on an exciting mix of beauty brands with continuous newness  all at an unbeatable value.” Target says it will continue to curate a differentiated beauty assortment for its customers  per the release. Meanwhile  Ulta emphasized the continuation of its omnichannel experience through the Ulta Beauty Marketplace launch later this year. The decision comes after Ulta CEO Kecia Steelman in April told an audience at J.P. Morgan’s annual Retail Round Up Conference the beauty retailer would pause on its expansion of new shop-in-shops at Target and declined to say what the partnership would look like after 2025. Instead  Steelman added  Ulta and Target would focus on investing in the existing 600-plus stores during 2025. The U.S. retailers first debuted the partnership in 2021 and met a goal to open 100 of the shop-in-shops later that year. At the time  industry analysts and executives at both retailers sounded optimistic that the deal would bring a fresh assortment to Target and expose Ulta to new customers. Years later  however  Target is undergoing a turnaround effort with a focus on merchandising changes  and Ulta is under new leadership  with Steelman taking on the CEO role in January after the surprise departure of Dave Kimbell. Target — under the helm of longtime CEO Brian Cornell — is working to overcome slumping sales and consumer backlash related to its DEI approach. Since the launch of a multi-year merchandise revamp in March  Target has changed its price matching policy  debuted an exclusive collection with home goods brand Parachute  and refreshed or launched new private labels.  Target also isn't done with shop-in-shops altogether: The retailer in February announced it would open five Warby Parker shops this year  staffed by employees from the traditionally direct-to-consumer optical brand. For Ulta  the partnership conclusion comes after it lost market share for the first time in 2024.  The CEOs for both companies have reiterated the desire to focus on retail fundamentals  such as store inventory and merchandise assortment.                                 purchase licensing rights       Filed Under: Operations            Retail Dive news delivered to your inbox Get the free daily newsletter read by industry experts   Email:           Select Newsletter:   Daily Dive M-F    Select Newsletter:   DTC Weekly Every Tuesday    Select Newsletter:   Marketing Weekly Every Wednesday    Select Newsletter:   Tech Weekly Every Thursday    Select Newsletter:   Operations Weekly Every Monday    Select user consent:         By signing up to receive our newsletter  you agree to our     Terms of Use and     Privacy Policy. What Does Russia’s ‘Accidental’ Troop Loss Admission Truly Mean?It happened on June 19  2025  in a CNN interview. Calm  polite  and almost casual. Russian Ambassador to the UK  Andrey Kelin  was trying to dismiss Ukraine’s...What Does Russia’s ‘Accidental’ Troop Loss Admission Truly Mean? | by Emil Stark | Aug  2025 | MediumSitemapOpen in appSign upSign inMedium LogoWriteSign upSign inWhat Does Russia’s ‘Accidental’ Troop Loss Admission Truly Mean?Emil Stark4 min read·Just now--ListenSharePress enter or click to view image in full sizeNewly mobilized conscripts during the partial mobilization. (Image: “Mobilised Russian recruits in Sevastopol ” via Wikipedia Commons  public domain)It happened on June 19  2025  in a CNN interview. Calm  polite  and almost casual. Russian Ambassador to the UK  Andrey Kelin  was trying to dismiss Ukraine’s claim that over a million Russian troops had been killed  wounded  or gone missing.Instead  he allowed something much more damaging to escape.“We now have almost 600 000 servicemen fighting in Ukraine ” he said.Just like that.One sentence is more destructive than a dozen HIMARS. Because in a war fought with censorship  that number was dynamite.Kelin attempted to give the question a routine tone. Routine. As if 600 000 troops sent to another country was just the other day in Moscow.But that number corroborates what Ukraine and Western intelligence have been shouting for months. Russia has already pushed hundreds of thousands into the grinder. And that the number is not greater? That’s what really tells the tale.Because Russia is not short of recruits. It has even been boasted by Moscow that 50 000 to 60 000 absentee volunteers are signing up monthly. Do the math. And if they’re training that many  month in and month out  why are only 600 000 left to stand?Where did the rest go?They did not get promoted. They did not retire. They are gone.Dead. Wounded. Captured. Or so shattered that they can no longer fight.Even more revealing? Putin had said last year that 700 000 troops were active. That was June 2024. And once again this month  in December  he said 617 000. But now  having all these new fresh bodies  the number is less?That’s attrition. Brutal  endless attrition. And Russia is spending lives just to stand still.Russia’s estimated casualty rates have ranged from 75 troops a day to 500 troops a day  with Western analyst from ISW George Barros saying Russia is likely losing 35 000 to 45 000 troops per month. Let that sink in. That’s the size of some entire armies. Every four weeks.Press enter or click to view image in full sizeMonthly breakdown of Russia’s manpower and armored vehicle losses  2022–2025.Source: Euromaidan Press — Creative Commons AttributionKELIN by “slip” did not disclose the actual number of casualties. But it gave us a sense of the shape of it. Like a stain of blood spreading through a white dress.Even more important? It was a Russian official who revealed this. Not an activist. Not Ukrainian intel. Not a Western general. A Kremlin diplomat  in fact speaking on the record  proffering to the world a rare crack in Russia’s tightly controlled mirror.Moscow generally treats casualty figures as state secrets. They arrested people who were counting graves. They’ve scrubbed obituaries. They have prohibited reporting from the front. The war is to be clean. Victory inevitable. Losses minimal.But reality doesn’t work that way.And now the world sees it. Or at least  hears it. There are hundreds of thousands  perhaps already more then out of the fight. He didn’t tell Kelin that  of course. He didn’t have to.You could hear it in the space of the silence between his words.And here’s the part that hurts the Kremlin most of all: This is not a statistic. It’s an admission. One they can’t walk back.Because right now  the math is too loud to ignore.Recruit 50 000 more new form-fillers a month just to maintain numbers? That’s not growth. That’s survival. It’s feeling like trying to fill a sinking ship with buckets. You’re not advancing. You’re drowning slower.And the price is not just human. It’s economic. Russia is hemorrhaging its treasury paying enlistment bonuses  survivor pensions  hospital care and for military funerals. Their own economy minister had just warned of the possibility of a recession. No surprise there.Because this war isn’t cheap. Especially when it never does.But there is a social cost as well. Each of those 600 000 men has a family. For each cadaver a home it will never return to. And as the Kremlin tries to conceal the coffins from behind the walls of a Potemkin village  the truth always seeps out.Sometimes through whispered tales.Sometimes via satellite images of expanding graveyards.And occasionally  in the soothed voice of a diplomat who had gone too far.The strategy is clear now. Russia is not preparing for a quick victory. It’s planning for endurance. Grind down Ukraine. Outlast the outrage. Bleed slowly.But there are limits to the war machine. Even a cold-blooded one  like Moscow’s.Because you can fake the numbers for only so long. You can only plug the ranks with prisoners and the poor temporarily for so many months before something breaks.And when a war needs 600 000 men on the ground just to keep the front from disintegrating  it is no longer a war of conquest.It’s a meat grinder.Kelin’s blunder wasn’t a gaffe. It was a warning. Not just to Ukraine. But to every Russian mother  every buried conscript  every silent town that is suddenly facing up to where its sons and daughters are missing.And to all the people watching from the outside  wondering how long this madness can possibly continue.Ukraine WarRussia Ukraine WarGeopoliticsWarTechnology----Written by Emil Stark0 followers·1 followingNo responses yetHelpStatusAboutCareersPressBlogPrivacyRulesTermsText to speech

Mars yang memiliki julukan sebagai “planet merah” akibat dari besi oksida yang berbentuk debu sehingga mudah terbawa oleh badai besar di planet tersebut.Dikutip dari situs resmi NASA  bahwa Mars dulunya memiliki sumber air yang bahkan lebih banyak dari samudra Arktik  sehingga sangat memungkinkan bagi hewan maupun tumbuhan untuk hidup. Menurut NASA  Mungkin sekitar 4 3 miliar tahun yang lalu  Mars memiliki cukup air untuk menutupi seluruh permukaannya dalam lapisan cair sedalam sekitar 137 meter. Kemungkinan besar  air tersebut membentuk samudra yang menempati hampir separuh belahan utara Mars  di beberapa wilayah mencapai kedalaman lebih dari 1 6 kilometer. bila mana kita menemukan air di tempat manapun  maka pasti ada kehidupan di tempat tersebut: “Bila Mars pernah memiliki air yang cair  atau masih memilikinya hari ini  menarik untuk bertanya apakah kehidupan mikroskopik dalam bentuk apa pun telah berkembang dipermukaannya?”Press enter or click to view image in full sizePara ilmuwan NASA telah memastikan bahwa samudra purba di Mars menyimpan lebih banyak air daripada Samudra Arktik Bumi  dan Planet Merah tersebut telah kehilangan 87 persen air tersebut ke luar angkasa. Kredit: NASA/GSFCPenelitian di permukaan Mars di mulai pada 1970an  yang mengirimkan dua robot Viking 1 dan 2  untuk mencari kehidupan mikroba  penelitian tersebut membawakan hasil yang positif  yaitu bukti bahwa planet tersebut pernah aktif secara geologis  dengan bukti – adanya bekas aliran sungai  yang diduga kuat adalah air dalam jumlah banyak – di masa lalu. Beberapa mineral yang ditemukan: Lempung Kaya Besi: Penjelajah Viking 1 dan 2 menemukan mineral lempung kaya besi di tanah Mars  yang hanya bisa terbentuk jika ada air cair. Namun  Eksperimen biologi wahana pendarat Viking tidak menghasilkan bukti yang pasti tentang adanya kehidupan di permukaannya.Press enter or click to view image in full sizeGambar wahana antariksa Viking  dengan pendaratnya terbungkus bioshield. Kredit: NASAPress enter or click to view image in full sizeAstronom Universitas Cornell  Carl Sagan  berdiri di samping model wahana pendarat Viking untuk memberikan skala. Kredit: NASAberbagai tantangan muncul dalam misi manusia untuk menjadikan Mars sebagai koloni selain bumi  salah satunya adalah keadaan atmosfer Mars yang tidak memungkinkan bagi manusia untuk tinggal di dalamnya.Dikutip dari Info Astronomy  bahwa “tekanan atmosfer di Mars tidak cukup untuk mempertahankan air dalam bentuk cair  kurangnya magnetosfer dan tipisnya atmosfer menjadi tantangan. Di permukaan planet ini tidak banyak terjadi perpindahan panas  penyekatan terhadap angin Surya terbilang rendah  sehingga dapat menyebabkan atmosfer Mars menjadi lebih tipis”Atmosfer Mars sangat tipis  hanya 1% yang merupakan atmosfer milik bumi  1 9% nitrogen  1 9% argon  sisanya adalah karbondioksida  dan sedikit jejak dari oksigen dan karbon monoksida. Penelitian di Mars mengungkapkan bahwa planet tersebut telah kehilangan atmosfernya  sebanyak 65% Argon yang pernah ada di atmosfernya telah hilang keluar angkasa. "Kami telah menentukan bahwa sebagian besar gas yang pernah ada di atmosfer Mars telah hilang ke luar angkasa " kata Bruce Jakosky  peneliti utama Mars Atmosphere and Volatile Evolution Mission (MAVEN)  Universitas Colorado di Boulder.Press enter or click to view image in full sizeInfografis ini menunjukkan bagaimana Mars kehilangan argon dan gas lainnya seiring waktu akibat 'sputtering’. Kredit: NASATantangan besar lainnya bagi misi untuk menjadikan Mars sebagai “Bumi kedua” adalah kondisi alam  Mars adalah gurun dingin  dengan struktur tanah yang keras dan berkerak. Mars terkenal dengan badai debu yang hebat  yang terkadang menimbulkan cukup banyak debu hingga dapat dilihat oleh teleskop dari bumi. Berdasarkan perkataan Michael Smith  seorang ilmuwan planet di Pusat Penerbangan Luar Angkasa Goddard NASA di Greenbelt  Maryland: “Setiap tahun ada beberapa badai debu yang cukup besar yang muncul di Mars dan menutupi area seukuran benua dan berlangsung selama berminggu-minggu "Jika badainya bisa berlangsung selama berminggu-minggu  maka akan sangat sulit bagi manusia untuk membangun koloni di sana  tidak mungkin bagi manusia untuk dapat beraktivitas di tengah badai debu. Planet Mars juga hampir mati secara geologis; aktivitas vulkanik telah sepenuhnya berakhir  menyebabkan terhentinya pendaur ulangan bahan kimia dan mineral antara permukaan dengan bagian dalam planet.Jika sebuah koloni dibentuk  maka perlu usaha berkesinambungan dan berbiaya besar untuk memeliharanya  termasuk misi penyelamatan. Lebih jauh lagi  isolasi jangka panjang bagi penduduk Mars mungkin memakan korban. pada 2013 proyek Mars One mengumumkan ingin merekrut empat orang untuk dikirim dalam misi kolonisasi Mars  Chris Chamber  seorang profesor ilmu saraf kognitif di Universitas Cardiff  memperingatkan tentang risiko psikologis yang akan dihadapi oleh penduduk di Mars jika seandainya proses kolonisasi berjalan dan dalam skala yang besar.Penelitian pada tahun 2017  mengungkapkan bahwa permukaan Mars mungkin lebih berbahaya bagi mikroorganisme dari pada yang diduga.Dikutip dari Scientific Report  astronom Jennifer Wadsworth dan Charles S. Cockell  telah menemukan perklorat  sebuah zat yang membuat bakteri tidak dapat bertahan hidup  zat ini ditemukan melimpah di permukaan Mars.Namun  meskipun berbagai tantangan dihadapi  para peneliti tetap berupaya untuk membangun koloni di Mars. Berdasarkan pernyataan NASA: “Bahkan meskipun Mars tidak memiliki kehidupan masa lalu atau masa kini  bagaimanapun juga  masih banyak hal menarik di cakrawala. Kita sendiri mungkin menjadi “kehidupan di Mars  jika manusia memilih pergi kesana suatu hari nanti”Dalam upaya menyiapkan proses tersebut  NASA dan beberapa lembaga yang terlibat  menggelontorkan bermiliar-miliar dolar AS  untuk mengembangkan teknologi-teknologi terbaru yang nantinya berguna bagi misi kolonisasi di Mars  dimulai dengan pengembangan terhadap baju Astronot yang dapat melindungi mereka dari debu partikel yang merusak  hingga pengembangan fisi nuklir demi energi berkelanjutan di Mars.Melalui misi perseverance  pada tahun 2021 robot penjelajah milik NASA mendarat di Mars  sambil membawa empat sampel bahan pakaian antariksa  dan para ilmuwan melakukan penilaian bagaimana keempat pakaian tersebut dapat bertahan setelah empat tahun di planet Mars. Apa yang dipelajari badan antariksa tentang kinerja material dari keempat sampel pakaian tersebut  di Mars akan menjadi dasar perancangan pakaian antariksa masa depan bagi para astronot di Planet Merah.Dikutip dari situs resmi NASA:” Sampel tersebut  masing-masing berukuran tiga perempat inci persegi (20 milimeter persegi)  merupakan bagian dari target kalibrasi yang digunakan untuk menguji pengaturan SHERLOC (Pemindaian Lingkungan Layak Huni dengan Raman & Luminescence untuk Bahan Organik dan Bahan Kimia)  instrumen di ujung lengan Perseverance.”Sampel-sampel tersebut meliputi sepotong pelindung helm polikarbonat; Vectran  bahan tahan potong yang digunakan untuk telapak tangan sarung tangan astronot; dua jenis Teflon  yang memiliki sifat anti-lengket anti-debu; dan bahan pakaian antariksa yang umum digunakan bernama Ortho-Fabric. Kain terakhir ini memiliki beberapa lapisan  termasuk Nomex  bahan tahan api yang ditemukan pada pakaian pemadam kebakaran; Gore-Tex  yang kedap air namun tetap bernapas; dan Kevlar  bahan kuat yang digunakan dalam rompi antipeluru yang membuat pakaian antariksa lebih tahan sobekPress enter or click to view image in full sizeGrafik ini menunjukkan ilustrasi prototipe pakaian antariksa (kiri)  beserta sampel pakaian yang dibawa oleh wahana penjelajah Perseverance milik NASA. Ini adalah material pakaian antariksa pertama yang pernah dikirim ke Mars. Kredit: NASAPress enter or click to view image in full sizePakaian antariksa generasi baru NASA dirancang untuk memberi astronaut lebih banyak mobilitas di Bulan dan Mars. Kredit: NASA“Ini adalah salah satu aspek berwawasan ke depan dari misi penjelajah ini — tidak hanya memikirkan sains terkini  tetapi juga tentang apa yang akan terjadi selanjutnya " kata ilmuwan planet Marc Fries dari Johnson Space Center NASA di Houston  yang membantu menyediakan bahan-bahan pakaian antariksa. "Kami sedang mempersiapkan manusia untuk akhirnya pergi dan menjelajahi Mars.”Seolah selangkah lagi menuju terwujudnya peradaban di Mars  NASA berhasil membuat sebuah teknologi Produksi oksigen lokal (MOXIE)  yang bisa memproduksi oksigen dari atmosfer kaya akan karbondioksida di planet Mars.MOXIE sebuah benda kotak kecil yang dapat melakukan pekerjaan pohon untuk memproduksi oksigen. MOXIE bekerja dengan mengambil atmosfer Mars yang penuh dengan karbon dioksida melalui filter HEPA penangkap debu  kemudian mengompres atmosfer melalui pompa gulir  memanaskannya hingga 800°Celcius  dan mengirimkannya melalui rakitan elektrolisis oksida padat (SOXE)  tempat Karbon dioksida mengalir di atas katoda yang dikatalisis berbasis nikel dan terurai menjadi ion oksigen dan karbon monoksida. Elektrolit keramik zirkonia yang distabilkan scandia secara selektif melewatkan ion oksigen ke anoda  tempat ion-ion tersebut bergabung kembali menjadi oksigen diatomik  yang diukur jumlah dan kemurniannya sebelum dilepaskan ke atmosfer Mars. Buangan katoda adalah campuran karbon dioksida   karbon monoksida  dan gas atmosfer inert  terutama argon dan nitrogen.Press enter or click to view image in full sizeMOXIE dengan penutup depan dilepas  memperlihatkan kompresor dan rakitan SOXE. Filter saluran masuk  sensor dan panel kontrol aliran  serta komponen elektronik tidak ditampilkan. Dimensi sasis MOXIE adalah 23 9 cm x 23 9 cm x 30 9 cm. Kredit: Science AdvanceMOXIE menjadi temuan yang menjanjikan bagi para ilmuwan  dalam rencananya  MOXIE harus dikirim terlebih dahulu ke Mars sebelum misi Manusia."Ini adalah demonstrasi pertama yang benar-benar menggunakan sumber daya di permukaan benda planet lain  dan mengubahnya secara kimiawi menjadi sesuatu yang akan berguna untuk misi manusia " kata wakil penyelidik utama MOXIE Jeffrey Hoffman  seorang profesor praktik di Departemen MIT bidang Aeronautika dan Astronautika.Teknologi Laser  kecepatan komunikasi dari Mars ke Bumi.Teknologi radio yang digunakan saat ini membutuhkan waktu yang sangat lama untuk mengirim peta Mars ke Bumi  setidaknya membutuhkan waktu selama sembilan tahun  tetapi dengan teknologi laser yang baru dikembangkan oleh NASA  alih-alih sembilan tahun  waktu tersebut bisa dipersingkat menjadi 9 Minggu saja. Misi manusia ke Mars lebih baik menggunakan teknologi Laser untuk tetap terhubung dengan Bumi. Teknologi Laser ini  bisa mengirimkan sejumlah besar Informasi dan data secara real-time termasuk gambar dan video.Dari Situs resmi NASA: “NASA membuktikan komunikasi laser mungkin dengan demonstrasi dari Bulan pada tahun 2013. Demo berikutnya dari badan tersebut akan bekerja melalui berbagai skenario operasional  menyempurnakan sistem penunjuk  dan mengatasi tantangan teknologi dari orbit Bumi rendah – hal-hal seperti awan dan gangguan komunikasi lainnya. NASA sedang membangun sistem kecil untuk menguji penerbangan luar angkasa manusia  termasuk di Stasiun Luar Angkasa Internasional dan misi Artemis berawak pertama. Muatan komunikasi laser lainnya akan menjelajah ke luar angkasa untuk membantu menginformasikan apa yang diperlukan untuk menggunakan teknologi yang sama jutaan dan jutaan mil jauhnya dari Bumi”Berbeda dengan Bumi  Mars tidak memiliki sumber daya yang melimpah  sehingga dibutuhkan teknologi yang bisa memasok listrik ke Mars tanpa batas.Badai debu di Mars dapat mengurangi jumlah cahaya matahari yang masuk  selain itu  partikel-partikel debu di Mars sangat kecil dan bersifat elektrostatik.Dikutip dari situs resmi NASA  “Debu merupakan masalah yang sangat besar bagi panel surya. Bahkan pusaran debu berukuran hanya beberapa kaki—yang jauh lebih kecil daripada badai debu biasa—dapat membawa debu yang cukup banyak untuk menutupi peralatan dan mengurangi jumlah sinar matahari yang mengenai panel. Berkurangnya sinar matahari berarti berkurangnya energi yang dihasilkan”Ini berarti bahwa panel Surya sangat rentan terhadap ancaman debu  sehingga sangat tidak cocok jika digunakan di Mars  untuk mengatasi tantangan ini  NASA mengembangkan teknologi fisi nuklir demi pasokan listrik yang aman dan berkelanjutan di Mars.Dikutip dari situs resmi NASA  “NASA telah menguji teknologi fisi nuklir Bumi dan menunjukkan bahwa teknologi ini aman  efisien  dan cukup berlimpah untuk memungkinkan misi permukaan jangka panjang. AI That Thinks With You: Designing Cognitive Tools for Human ComplexityMost AI tools today are built for clarity  speed  and output. But human thinking doesn’t always move like that. We loop. We pause. We zoom in and out. We shif...AI That Thinks With You: Designing Cognitive Tools for Human Complexity | by Sára | Soft EDGE Studio | Aug  2025 | MediumSitemapOpen in appSign upSign inMedium LogoWriteSign upSign inAI That Thinks With You: Designing Cognitive Tools for Human ComplexitySára | Soft EDGE Studio3 min read·Just now--ListenShareSára OlsenWhat if AI didn’t just respond to what you typed – but adapted to how you think?Most AI tools today are built for clarity  speed  and output. But human thinking doesn’t always move like that. We loop. We pause. We zoom in and out. We shift tone depending on mood  energy  or cognitive load.Despite advances in human-AI collaboration  current systems still prioritize task efficiency over cognitive resonance – neglecting how humans actually navigate complex thought (Amershi et al.  2019; Shneiderman  2020).This reflection stems from lived experimentation – not academic research  but hands-on orchestration of AI threads across real-world creative  strategic  and emotional work.Beyond Input-Output: Orchestration as Interaction DesignWhen I started working with multiple AI threads – one for structure  one for tone  one for insight – something changed. Instead of trying to “get better prompts ” I began conducting the system like a layered conversation.That shift led me to develop:Flow Anchors™ – simple prompts like “Pause for synthesis” or “Switch rhythm” to regulate attention and momentum (see also Zimmerman  2002).Meaning Modulation™ – adjusting the tone  style  or depth of AI responses based on my emotional or cognitive bandwidth (see Picard  1997; Tkalčič & Chen  2015).These aren’t productivity hacks. They’re scaffolds for metacognition and emotional self-regulation – still mostly missing from AI design.What’s Missing in Current Research and DesignWhile agentic AI  adaptive learning systems  and AI tutors are rapidly evolving  there’s still limited focus on:Emotionally responsive UX in AI workflowsTools that support cognitive rhythm and reflectionMetacognitive scaffolding in everyday AI interaction (Winne & Hadwin  1998; Sengers et al.  2005)In educational and design contexts  we’re still building AI to inform – not to resonate.A Personal Framework: The Valley of CollaborationOver time  I started visualizing the process as a terrain – what I now call the Valley of Collaboration. In this model  AI agents play different cognitive roles. The human moves between them – not linearly  but rhythmically. Not just as “user ” but as navigator.This valley isn’t a product. It’s a way to think about thinking – and design for it.Closing ThoughtThis isn’t a research paper. It’s a field note. But it points to something worth exploring:What would AI look like if it helped us think in rhythm with ourselves?Not just smarter – but softer. Not just fast – but aware.Let’s build tools that adapt as we do.Methodology & ContextThis article presents a reflective synthesis grounded in practitioner-based inquiry rather than empirical experimentation. The concepts discussed – such as Flow Anchors™  Meaning Modulation™  and the Valley of Collaboration – emerged through sustained interaction with AI systems (primarily large language models) in the context of creative ideation  strategy development  and learning design.Over the course of several months  I engaged in structured multi-threaded dialogues with AI agents  each assigned a distinct cognitive role (e.g.  strategist  editor  emotional mirror). These sessions were iteratively documented  clustered  and synthesized using digital scaffolding tools such as Notion. Recurring patterns in emotional rhythm  cognitive pacing  and task navigation informed the conceptual models presented here.This work draws from a multidisciplinary foundation – including cognitive science  affective computing  metacognitive theory  and reflective UX design – to explore how AI systems might support more emotionally attuned and cognitively adaptive human workflows.Although exploratory and situated in practice  the intention is to contribute to an ongoing conversation within human-computer interaction (HCI)  educational technology  and AI-assisted cognition. This article should be read as an applied perspective that bridges lived experience with theoretical insight – intended to invite further dialogue and refinement across disciplines.✍️ About the AuthorSára Olsen works across psychology  language  and creative systems design. Her work focuses on emotionally intelligent workflows and cognitive scaffolding for interdisciplinary thinkers.🔍 Selected ReferencesAmershi  S.  Weld  D.  Vorvoreanu  M.  Fourney  A.  Nushi  B.  Collisson  P.  … & Horvitz  E. (2019). Guidelines for human-AI interaction. CHI ’19.Picard  R. W. (1997). Affective Computing. MIT Press.Sengers  P.  Boehner  K.  David  S.  & Kaye  J. (2005). Reflective design. Critical Computing  49 – 58.Shneiderman  B. (2020). Human-centered artificial intelligence: Reliable  safe & trustworthy. IJHCI  36(6)  495 – 504.Tkalčič  M.  & Chen  L. (2015). Emotions and personality in personalized services. Springer.Winne  P. H.  & Hadwin  A. F. (1998). Studying as self-regulated learning. Metacognition in Educational Theory and Practice  93  27 – 30.Zimmerman  B. J. (2002). Becoming a self-regulated learner: An overview. 5 Mistakes Photographers Make When Buying a New LensEvery photographer dreams of that pristine lens collection  but many end up with expensive glass gathering dust while scrambling to find the lenses they actuall...                 5 Mistakes Photographers Make When Buying a New Lens | Fstoppers                                                                                                        LatestNews Fstoppers Originals Trending Most Bookmarked All Categories  Reviews StorePhotography Tutorials Photoshop Plugins  CommunityRecent Activity Editors' Picks Photo of the Day Popular Photos Discussion Groups  Contests      Loading ...  Log In Sign Up                         Home  Education  Business      5 Mistakes Photographers Make When Buying a New Lens             by Alex Cooke August 14  2025                    0                Comments          FacebookX  0 Comments         Every photographer dreams of that pristine lens collection  but many end up with expensive glass gathering dust while scrambling to find the lenses they actually need. The brutal reality is that lens purchases gone wrong hurt because good glass costs so much and directly determines whether you can accept paying jobs.     1. Paying for f/1.2 You Do Not Use The lens sits in the display case like jewelry  that 85mm f/1.2 gleaming under the shop lights. The sales pitch writes itself: ultimate bokeh  extraordinary low-light performance  the pinnacle of optical engineering. You imagine portraits with backgrounds that melt into impressionist paintings  available light wedding ceremonies captured without flash  street photography in near darkness. At $3 000  it costs more than many camera bodies  but surely this represents an investment in artistic excellence. Six months later  you pull up your Lightroom catalog and filter by that lens. The metadata tells an embarrassing story. Of 2 000 images shot with your prized f/1.2  exactly twelve were captured wide open. The vast majority cluster around f/2.8 to f/4. Those dreamy portraits you imagined? You shot them at f/2 because your clients kept complaining that only one eye was in focus at f/1.2. Those dark wedding ceremonies? You used f/1.8 with higher ISO because you needed more depth of field to capture both people in couples shots. The $3 000 lens delivered $1 200 lens performance because that's all you actually used. The mathematics of ultra-fast apertures reveal uncomfortable truths. Moving from f/2 to f/1.4 gains you a stop of light. In practical terms  that's the difference between ISO 3200 and ISO 1600  a distinction that's close to invisible in final output from a modern camera and processing software. But the price difference between the standard 85mm f/1.8 and the 85mm f/1.4 of f/1.2 is often about $1 000.  The depth of field at f/1.2 creates more problems than it solves for working photographers. On a full frame camera at 85mm  focusing on a subject's near eye at 8 feet gives you roughly 2 inches of depth at f/1.2. The far eye goes soft. The nose blurs. Any movement forward or backward throws the shot completely out of focus. Your keeper rate plummets while your stress levels soar. Meanwhile  at f/2  you get about 4 inches of depth  enough to keep a face sharp while still achieving beautiful background separation. Professional portrait photographers discovered this decades ago  which is why so many work at f/2.8 to f/4 despite owning faster glass. Consider the physical penalties of ultra-fast glass. The Canon RF 50mm f/1.2L weighs 950 grams. The RF 50mm f/1.8 STM weighs 160 grams. You're carrying six times the weight for that extra stop. The f/1.2 version also requires 77mm filters at premium prices  while the f/1.8 uses affordable 43mm filters. Pack three f/1.2 primes for a wedding  and you've added 6 pounds to your bag before considering cameras or other gear. Autofocus precision becomes critical and problematic with ultra-fast apertures. The margin for error at f/1.2 is so thin that minor issues ruin shots. The slightest front or back focus (if you're using a DSLR) that goes unnoticed at f/2.8 becomes catastrophic at f/1.2 (ask me about my adventures with that).    Video work exposes another f/1.2 liability that photographers rarely consider until too late. That gorgeous shallow depth of field becomes a nightmare when subjects move even slightly. Professional videographers rarely shoot wider than f/2.8 for interviews because maintaining focus at f/1.2 while someone gestures naturally is nearly impossible. You'll need variable ND filters to control exposure in daylight  adding $200 to $400 per lens. The focus breathing on many f/1.2 lenses makes focusing jarring. Suddenly that "cinema-quality" lens requires so many workarounds that a modest f/1.8 or f/2 alternative would produce better results. The optical compromises at maximum aperture further diminish the value proposition. Even premium lenses often show noticeable vignetting  reduced contrast  and corner softness when shot wide open. You're paying premium prices for performance that the lens can't fully deliver. Most f/1.2 or f/1.4 lenses reach peak sharpness around f/2.8 to f/4  exactly where you'd get similar results from an f/1.8 lens costing half as much. Rent that dream f/1.2 lens for a typical job. Shoot your normal subjects in your usual conditions. Then examine the files critically. Can you consistently nail focus at f/1.2? Do clients notice or care about the difference between f/1.2 and f/1.8 backgrounds? Does the extra weight slow you down or cause fatigue? Most importantly  review your current work and count how many images would have genuinely benefited from f/1.2 versus f/1.8. If it's less than 20%  you're shopping for specifications  not solutions. 2. Skipping Weather-Sealing The rain starts during the ceremony. Not a downpour  just steady drops that send guests scrambling for cover. You're the wedding photographer  so you keep shooting  confident in your skills and determination. Twenty minutes later  your $2 000 lens stops focusing. The autofocus motor whirs but won't lock. By reception time  condensation fogs the rear element. Monday morning  the repair estimate arrives: $800 and three weeks without your primary portrait lens.  Weather-sealing sounds like insurance you'll never need until the moment you desperately need it. Photographers consistently underestimate their exposure to moisture  dust  and environmental hazards. It's not just rain you're fighting. Beach sand infiltrates focus rings within minutes. Concert fog machines coat front elements with glycol residue. Kitchen steam from food photography condenses inside lens barrels. Sweat from your hands corrodes lens contacts during summer weddings. Your own breath fogs unprotected glass when shooting winter sports. Dust infiltration creates insidious problems that accumulate over time. Without sealing  zoom lenses can act like bellows  sucking particles into the barrel with every focal length change. Initially  you might notice a few specks that don't affect image quality. After a year of regular use  especially in dusty environments  the internal elements develop a haze that reduces contrast and causes flare. This is a particular issue with push-pull zoom lenses.   Salt air devastates unsealed lenses faster than photographers realize. One beach portrait session can start corrosion that spreads for months. The metal components in aperture mechanisms oxidize. Electronic contacts develop resistance that causes communication errors. Zoom rings become gritty and resistant. A good lens includes fluorine coating on the front element specifically to repel salt spray  while budget telephoto lenses lacking this protection require constant cleaning that eventually scratches the coating. Professional use amplifies the importance of weather-sealing exponentially. A hobbyist can choose when to shoot. Professionals shoot when clients pay them  regardless of conditions. That proposal on the rain-soaked beach happens whether your gear is ready or not. The outdoor corporate event proceeds through morning mist. The music festival continues through dust storms. Sports rarely stop for weather. With sealed lenses  you keep working. Without sealing  you're either risking equipment damage or losing income. Internal focusing and zoom designs provide benefits beyond moisture protection. Lenses that extend during zooming or focusing constantly exchange air with the environment  pulling in whatever's floating around. An internal design also improves balance on gimbals and reduces the likelihood of impact damage from the extending barrel hitting objects. The resale value difference between sealed and unsealed lenses grows over time. A three-year-old weather-sealed lens that's been properly maintained looks and functions like new. An unsealed lens used in the same conditions shows its age through accumulated internal dust  worn coatings  and potentially degraded mechanics.    3. Underestimating Weight and Balance The lens arrives in its impressive box  a monument to optical excellence. On paper  the specifications dazzle: incredible sharpness  creamy bokeh  professional build quality. You mount it on your camera for the first test shoot. Within fifteen minutes  your wrist aches. After an hour  sharp pain shoots up your forearm. By the end of a full portrait session  you can barely hold the camera steady. The lens weighs several pounds  nearly twice what your camera body weighs  creating a front-heavy combination that transforms photography from joy to endurance test. Balance matters more than absolute weight  a principle photographers learn through painful experience. A 1 000-gram lens with proper weight distribution feels lighter than a 700-gram lens that puts all its mass at the front element. That leverage principle means every gram past your grip point counts double or triple in fatigue terms. The cumulative effect of poor balance appears gradually but inevitably. Your minimum handholdable shutter speed increases because micro-tremors from muscle fatigue create camera shake. What you could shoot at 1/125 second in the morning requires 1/250 second by afternoon. Your composition suffers because you're rushing to relieve strain rather than waiting for perfect moments. You start avoiding certain angles because holding the camera overhead or at arm's length becomes painful. The technical quality of your work declines not because of skill but because of physical limitation. Working photographers discover that theoretical optical superiority means nothing if the lens stays home. That Sigma 105mm f/1.4 Art might produce marginally better bokeh than the 85mm f/1.8  but if you're leaving it behind because of weight  you're getting zero bokeh instead of slightly less perfect bokeh. The Canon RF 85mm f/2 Macro IS STM weighs 500 grams and balances perfectly on any RF body. It might not win lens charts competitions  but it wins the only competition that matters: actually being used to create images. Event photography crystallizes the weight penalty sharply. A wedding photographer typically shoots for eight to twelve hours  raises the camera hundreds of times  walks several miles  crouches  climbs  stretches. Every extra gram compounds across thousands of movements. Two photographers with identical skills but different lens choices will produce different results by hour ten.  Tripod and gimbal work reveals another weight consideration photographers overlook. Heavy lenses require heavier support systems. That lightweight travel tripod rated for 3 kilograms might technically support your 2-kilogram lens and camera combination  but it won't always dampen vibrations effectively. You need a tripod rated for double your actual load for stability  meaning heavier legs  bigger heads  and more weight to carry. The landscape photographer choosing the lighter option can hike farther  stay out longer  and access locations the heavier lens would make impossible. Video work amplifies balance problems exponentially. Handheld video with a front-heavy lens produces unwatchable footage as micro-tremors translate into jittery motion. Gimbal motors strain against unbalanced loads  burning through batteries and potentially burning out motors.  The grip enhancement trap catches photographers who try to solve balance problems with accessories. Adding a battery grip seems logical for improving balance with heavy lenses. But now you're carrying extra battery weight all day even when using light lenses. You've solved one problem by creating another  adding systemic weight instead of addressing the real issue: lens selection. 4. Buying Specialty Primes Before Workhorse Glass The vintage lens groups online seduce you with their rendering character. Your cart fills with fascinating specialty glass that will define your unique style. Meanwhile  you don't own a single zoom lens or conventional prime that covers standard focal lengths reliably. Three months later  reality delivers its verdict. A client needs corporate headshots with consistent sharpness  not artistic blur. A wedding couple wants group photos of thirty people  not shallow depth of field experiments. An event requires coverage from 24mm to 200mm  not the three artistic primes you bought. You've spent $3 000 on glass you can't use professionally and now need another $5 000 for lenses that actually generate income. The portfolio deception drives many poor purchase decisions. Photographers see striking images created with unusual lenses and assume they need similar tools. That infrared photograph captured with a converted sensor and special filters looks otherworldly. The tilt-shift architectural image corrects perspective beautifully. The macro photograph reveals details invisible to naked eyes. But examine most working photographers' metadata and you'll find 80% of professional images come from boring  practical focal lengths: 24-70mm and 70-200mm zooms or 35mm  50mm  and 85mm primes. The spectacular portfolio pieces grab attention  but the workhorse lenses pay bills. Building backwards from specialty to general creates coverage gaps that embarrass professionals. You can't shoot group photos with your 135mm f/1.8 portrait lens unless you have a football field of space. The manual focus 40mm f/1.2 that renders beautifully can't track moving subjects at weddings. Each specialty lens excels at one thing while failing at ten others. Professional work demands versatility first  specialization second. The rental market reveals what photographers actually need versus what they want. Check any rental house's most popular lenses and you'll see those aforementioned boring lenses. These aren't exciting. They don't create unique looks. But they're rented constantly because they solve real problems. The exotic lenses sit on shelves except for specific projects where their unique capabilities justify the rental fee. This pattern should inform purchase priorities  but photographers consistently ignore it. The learning curve for specialty lenses compounds the problem. Mastering a tilt-shift lens requires understanding Scheimpflug principle  practicing movements  and developing new composition instincts. Achieving consistent results with ultra-fast manual focus lenses demands different shooting techniques. Macro photography needs specialized lighting and stabilization approaches. While you're learning these specialized skills  you're not improving with the standard lenses that most clients actually need. You become an amateur in multiple specialties instead of a professional in core competencies. 5. Forgetting Focus Breathing for Video The interview setup looks professional. Your subject sits perfectly lit  everything dialed in for a cinematic look. You start with a wide shot for context  then slowly rack focus to the subject's face for emotional impact. On the monitor  something horrifying happens. As focus shifts  the frame noticeably zooms  making it appear like you're simultaneously focusing and zooming. The subject's head grows larger  the background shifts  and the entire shot screams "amateur production" despite your expensive lens. Focus breathing  the change in focal length as focus distance changes  affects most photography lenses to varying degrees. Manufacturers optimize still lenses for maximum sharpness and bokeh quality  often accepting breathing as a compromise. For photography  this rarely matters. For video  it's catastrophic. Every focus pull becomes a distraction that breaks viewer immersion. The problem multiplies with modern autofocus systems that constantly hunt for precision. Your camera's face detection makes micro-adjustments continuously  causing the frame to pulse subtly as breathing translates these focus movements into magnification changes. What looks like nervous camera work is actually your lens breathing with every AF adjustment.  Cinema lenses exist specifically to eliminate these problems  but their prices shock photographers. The difference? Perfect breathing control  standard gear positions  consistent size across focal lengths  and apertures marked in T-stops for accurate exposure. For photographers shooting occasional video  cinema lenses are overkill. But understanding why they cost more helps evaluate whether breathing matters for your work. Electronic breathing compensation offers a partial solution with significant limitations. Sony's breathing compensation in cameras like the a7 IV crops the image to maintain consistent framing during focus changes. This works but costs resolution and field of view. You're essentially shooting with a longer focal length and lower resolution than expected. The compensation also only works with specific Sony lenses  leaving third-party options without correction. Similar compromises happen with other systems. Professional videographers develop workarounds that photographers should understand. They pull focus more slowly to make breathing less noticeable. They compose with extra room to allow cropping in post. They choose interview positions where breathing won't intersect with important background elements. Some use zoom lenses instead of primes  counterintuitively  because many modern zooms breathe less than primes. Or  they use cinema lenses.  The Strategic Lens Purchase Smart lens purchasing starts with brutal honesty about actual needs versus gear acquisition syndrome. That dream lens collection on your wishlist might impress forums but won't improve your photography if it doesn't match your shooting reality. Professional photographers often succeed with surprisingly modest lens selections. They choose reliability over perfection  versatility over specialization  and proven performance over cutting-edge technology. The 24-70mm f/2.8 might not excite you  but it stays mounted on more professional cameras than any exotic prime because it solves real problems reliably. Understanding this principle before purchasing saves thousands of dollars and years of frustration. Your next lens purchase should fill a genuine gap in capability  not a perceived gap in quality. If clients are happy with your current images  that f/1.2 upgrade won't generate more bookings. If you're consistently renting the same focal length  that's your next purchase. If weather cancellations cost you money  prioritize sealed lenses. Build your lens collection like a business tool inventory  not an art collection. The lens that makes you money is always better than the lens that makes you excited.
